{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3139637,"name":"dravis","username":"dravis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dravis/{size}/217924_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-04T18:43:36.051Z","cooked":"

Can anyone help me with some code examples for using a Rev Through Bore Encoder / absolute sensor? I have always used CTRE/mag and can’t seem to find examples of measuring the Rev. I plan to use it in DIO->roboRIO.

I originally wanted to try it as an external encoder to the SparkMAX but I had read that wasn’t supported (for absolute mode), only for relative/quadrature mode. I am using this to position an elevator.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-04T18:43:36.051Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1612,"reads":302,"readers_count":301,"score":8120.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":425761,"topic_slug":"rev-encoder-absolute-mode-code-examples","display_username":"dravis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17874,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-encoder-absolute-mode-code-examples/425761/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3139642,"name":"KaseyB","username":"KaseyB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaseyb/{size}/176177_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-04T18:49:06.907Z","cooked":"

As of this year, the Through Bore encoder (in absolute mode) can be used as an external feedback device directly wired to the Spark Max using this breakout board. You can take a look at the Rev Max Swerve code template for some initialization and setup. The turning encoder in the code is a through bore encoder connected to the Spark Max.

REV Robotics","clicks":103}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17874,"username":"dravis","name":"dravis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dravis/{size}/217924_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4469 Control System Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-encoder-absolute-mode-code-examples/425761/2","custom_user_title":"4469 Control System Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3139660,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-04T19:20:40.953Z","cooked":"

If you are using it as an absolute encoder with a DIO port on the Roborio you should be able to use the DutyCycleEncoder class. You need to make a new DigitalInput Object with the port you are using when you construct the object. Example

DigitalInput input = new DigitalInput(0);
DutyCycleEncoder encoder = new DutyCycleEncoder(input);

You should then be able to retrieve information with the methods provided with the DutyCycleEncoder class.

If you already have the Data Port Breakout Board, you can solder the outputs from the encoder and it works the same as the absolute breakout board.

This post has the details on how to connect the appropriate wires to the Data Port Breakout Board.

REV Robotics

SPARK MAX Data Port Breakout Board

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Average Rating: 4

Price: USD 10

If you are wiring it DIO to the Rio, you can use the DutyCycleEncoder, multiply by 2π and subtract some kind of zero angle to get a meaningful measurement.
